did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.unittitle: Eleanor Lee Reading Templeman local history collection
did.abstract: This collection contains materials used by northern Virginia historian Eleanor Lee Templeman to produce the books Northern Virginia Heritage and Arlington Heritage. Materials include maps, drawings, negatives, pamphlets, and printing plates.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on personal use. Permission to publish material from the Eleanor Lee Reading Templeman local history collection must be obtained from Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Eleanor Lee Reading Templeman local history collection, C0160, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated by Eleanor Templeman in 1981.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Special Collections and Archives staff. EAD markup completed by Eron Ackerman and Jordan Patty in April 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Born in 1906, Eleanor Lee Reading Templeman was a local historian, author, preservationist and photographer. From 1947 until her death in 1990, Mrs. Templeman served the Society of the Lees of Virginia as Secretary, Genealogist and Historian. She wrote four books and numerous journal articles, primarily on the Lee family and also local history. Mrs. Templeman was a driving force behind legislation to preserve Sully Plantation (1958) and the creation of Leesylvania State Park (1978). Throughout her life Mrs. Templeman collected clippings and notes on subjects related to the Lee family as well as items of local interest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials used by Northern Virginia historian Eleanor Lee Templeman to produce the books Northern Virginia Heritage and Arlington Heritage. Materials include maps, drawings, negatives, pamphlets, and printing plates.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged by subject and type of material.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections and Archives holds many other collections on Northern Virginia history.

did.unittitle: An electronic box inventory is unavailable. Please contact speccoll@gmu.edu for more information.
